summary: This document is an email chain from August 17, 2021, between U.S. Department of Justice officials and a journalist from The Sun regarding a media inquiry about Prince Andrew's cooperation with the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. It discusses a planned official response to questions about a Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty (MLAT) request and the status of U.S.-U.K. law enforcement cooperation.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: The Duke of York is the central subject of the journalist's inquiry regarding his alleged failure to cooperate with the U.S. investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and the status of a U.S. MLAT request.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Deceased financier and subject of investigation
persons.context: The investigation referenced throughout the email chain is into the crimes of Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Aaron D. Snipe
persons.role: Senior Communications Advisor for International Law Enforcement/Spokesperson, U.S. Department of Justice
persons.context: A U.S. DOJ official based at the U.S. Embassy in London who is coordinating the response to a media inquiry from The Sun about Prince Andrew and the Epstein investigation.

connections.description: The U.S. investigation into Jeffrey Epstein involves seeking cooperation from Prince Andrew, as indicated by the media inquiry about an MLAT request.
Aaron Snipe, as a DOJ spokesperson, is handling official communications regarding the media inquiry about Prince Andrew's cooperation with the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Media Inquiry from The Sun
events.description: A journalist from The Sun contacts the U.S. Department of Justice to inquire about Prince Andrew's alleged failure to cooperate with the Epstein investigation and the status of a U.S. MLAT request made the previous summer.

events.title: MLAT Request Lodged
events.description: The U.S. Department of Justice lodged a Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty request with the United Kingdom regarding the Jeffrey Epstein investigation, seeking cooperation from Prince Andrew.

locations: Embassy of the United States of America, Nine Elms, London, United Kingdom
1 London Bridge Street, London, SE1 9GF (News Corp UK & Ireland Limited office)
keyFacts: In August 2021, the U.S. DOJ was fielding media inquiries about Prince Andrew's alleged failure to cooperate with the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.
The U.S. had lodged a Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty (MLAT) request with the U.K. in the summer of 2020 regarding the Epstein investigation and Prince Andrew.
The planned U.S. government response was to neither confirm nor deny the existence of any MLAT request, citing standard policy.
A journalist's inquiry suggested that Prince Andrew's team believed they had not been contacted by British authorities over the MLAT and that the matter had been 'kicked into the long grass.'
